intro: Didiscus acerifolius, commonly known as the maple-leaf didiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves that resemble those of maple trees. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Didiscus acerifolius is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
